capabilities.description: Netboot is able to change file ownership arbitrarily
capabilities.name: CHOWN

capabilities.description: Netboot is able to bypass file permission checks
capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE

capabilities.description: Netboot is able to bypass permission checks for file operations
capabilities.name: FOWNER

capabilities.name: KILL

capabilities.name: NET_BIND_SERVICE

capabilities.description: Netboot is able to change group ID of processes
capabilities.name: SETGID

capabilities.description: Netboot is able to change user ID of processes
capabilities.name: SETUID

capabilities.description: Netboot is able to use chroot() system call
capabilities.name: SYS_CHROOT

attrs.label: TFTPD Options
attrs.description: Additional options for the TFTPD service.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Netboot.xyz files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Netboot.xyz files will be owned by.

attrs.label: TFTP Port
attrs.description: The TFTP port for netboot.xyz.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

1.2.7.readme:
Netboot.xyz

netboot.xyz lets you PXE boot various operating system installers or utilities from a single tool over the network.
